intro: Viola hideoi, commonly known as the Japanese violet, is a herbaceous perennial native to Japan. It features heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and produces delicate, violet-colored flowers with yellow centers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 10-15 centimeters and thrives in cool, moist environments. It is often found in shaded woodland areas and is valued for its ornamental appeal. Viola hideoi is also noted for its ability to bloom throughout the spring season.
